setTableRemarks.remarks: a bridge (or closure) table which stores information for quick hierarchy traversals

setColumnRemarks.remarks: type of entity this record represents (ORG_UNIT, MEASURABLE, etc)
the id of the descendant (lower) entity in the hierarchy
the id of the ancestor (higher) entity in the hierarchy
the depth of the ancestor
the depth of the descendant

changeSet.author: davidwatkins73
changeSet.sql: update entity_hierarchy a set descendant_level = ( select b.level from entity_hierarchy b where b.id = a.id and b.ancestor_id = a.id and b.kind = a.kind);

changeSet.author: davidwatkins73
changeSet.sql: with a as ( select * from entity_hierarchy ) update a set descendant_level = ( select b.level from entity_hierarchy b where b.id = a.id and b.ancestor_id = a.id and b.kind = a.kind);

setTableRemarks.remarks: contains configuration data which controls the operation of Waltz.

setColumnRemarks.remarks: the key name of the setting, often uses dotted notation. Strongly recommended to put client specific settings under their own namespace (i.e. mycorp.somesetting)
the value of the setting, if the setting is a boolean it should be entered as lowercase
restricted settings are internal to Waltz and not available via API/external calls
optional comment to describe this setting

setTableRemarks.remarks: logs user page and section views

setColumnRemarks.remarks: identifier of the user accessing the page or section
identifier of the page plus optionally a section identifier (format: state|section)
additional params provided to page/section

setTableRemarks.remarks: represents a non application entity, typically used in flows. Examples include exchanges, departments, counterpart organisations

setColumnRemarks.remarks: short name identifying the actor (i.e. Bank of England)
longer textual description of the actor
flag to indicate whether this is an internal actor (e.g. Chief Risk Officer) or external actor (e.g. Bank of England)
where did this actor record originate, will be 'waltz' if provided via the UI
identifier this actor is known by externally. Should not change, unlike the name which may change.

setTableRemarks.remarks: allocations are used to apportion shares of a particular scheme (i.e. TCO) against an entity (e.g. applications) and measurable. The total for a given scheme and entity should be lte 100

setColumnRemarks.remarks: identifier (and fk) to a particular allocation scheme
identifier of the entity this allocation refers to
kind of the entity (e.g. APPLICATION) this allocation refers to
which measurable is being given an allocation for this entity
the allocation percentage given to this entity/measurable

setTableRemarks.remarks: allocation_schemes provide a named definition which allows entities to record allocations against a particular measurable category. (e.g. the 'Function Cost Shred' would be for applications to record allocations against their Functional Taxonomy measurable mappings)

setColumnRemarks.remarks: short name describing this allocation scheme (i.e. 'Function Cost Shred')
longer description to provide more information about this allocation scheme
defines the category of measurables this allocation scheme refers to
typically used when setting allocations via external batch processes (e.g. 'FT_COST')
